With a rich history of groundbreaking innovations in Flash and advanced memory technologies, our solutions have become the beating heart of the digital world we’re living in and that we have the power to shape.Sandisk meets people and businesses at the intersection of their aspirations and the moment, enabling them to keep moving and pushing possibility forward. We do this through the balance of our powerhouse manufacturing capabilities and our industry-leading portfolio of products that are recognized globally for innovation, performance and quality.Sandisk has two facilities recognized by the World Economic Forum as part of the Global Lighthouse Network for advanced 4IR innovations. These facilities were also recognized as Sustainability Lighthouses for breakthroughs in efficient operations. With our global reach, we ensure the global supply chain has access to the Flash memory it needs to keep our world moving forward.Job DescriptionJoin our innovative team in Milpitas, United States, for an exciting Summer 2026 internship opportunity in Advanced Memory Technology Group. As an intern, you'll have the chance to apply machine learning, deep learning, and Large Language Models (LLMs) for semiconductor process technology development.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Develop and evaluate AI/ML models to analyze semiconductor process, device, and metrology dataApply LLMs for:Knowledge extraction from process logs, experiment reports, and technical documentationAssisting with root-cause analysis and hypothesis generationAutomating data interpretation and reporting workflowsDesign end-to-end ML pipelines, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deploymentExplore advanced learning techniques such as:Physics-informed machine learningBayesian optimization for process tuningReinforcement learning for process controlCollaborate with domain experts to translate semiconductor process challenges into tractable AI problemsPresent findings through technical reports, presentations, and (where applicable) internal publications or patentsQualificationsRequired:Currently pursuing a PhD degree majoring in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Materials Science & Engineering, Chemical Engineering or equivalent engineering discipline with understanding of Semiconductor Fabrication.Strong foundation in machine learning and statistical modelingHands-on experience with Python and at least one ML framework: PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAXExperience working with Large Language Models (LLMs), such as:Model fine-tuning (full or parameter-efficient methods)Prompt engineeringRetrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)Familiarity with data handling and analysis libraries (e.g., NumPy, Pandas, scikit-learn)Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a research-driven engineering
